item.title: PB Fintech Ltd Forms Death Cross, Signalling Potential Bearish Trend
item.description: PB Fintech Ltd has recently formed a Death Cross, a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average (DMA) crosses below the 200-DMA, signalling a potential shift towards a bearish trend. This development reflects a deterioration in the stock’s momentum and raises concerns about its medium to long-term outlook amid ongoing market pressures. Time: 18 minutes ago

item.title: Quarterly Earnings Review: Dec-2025 Results Show Mixed Trends Across Market Caps
item.description: The December 2025 quarterly earnings season has revealed a nuanced picture across Indian equities, with 49.0% of companies reporting positive results, marking a notable improvement from the previous quarter’s 43.0%. Mid-cap stocks have emerged as the strongest performers, outpacing both large and small caps in terms of profit growth and operational metrics, while select large and small caps delivered standout performances that underscore sectoral strengths and evolving market dynamics. Time: 18 minutes ago

item.title: Kaycee Industries Q3 FY26: Profit Growth Masks Margin Erosion Concerns
item.description: Kaycee Industries Limited, a Mumbai-based electrical equipment manufacturer, reported consolidated net profit of ₹1.09 crores for Q3 FY26 (October-December 2025), representing a year-on-year growth of 15.96% but a sequential decline of 18.66% from Q2 FY26. The company's stock, currently trading at ₹729.30 with a market capitalisation of ₹225.00 crores, has witnessed significant volatility, plunging 36.12% over the past year despite strong three-year returns of 398.81%. Time: 32 minutes ago

item.title: Garware Marine Industries Q3 FY26: Micro-Cap Struggles with Margin Compression Despite Modest Revenue Recovery
item.description: Garware Marine Industries Ltd., a micro-cap player in the garments and apparels sector with a market capitalisation of ₹15.00 crores, reported a net profit of ₹0.05 crores for Q3 FY26 (October-December 2025), marking a sharp decline of 44.44% quarter-on-quarter and 16.67% year-on-year. The company's stock traded at ₹25.38 on February 03, 2026, down 30.06% from its 52-week high of ₹36.29, reflecting persistent concerns about operational performance and profitability sustainability in this Mumbai-based manufacturer. Time: 32 minutes ago

item.title: Kamat Hotels Q3 FY26: Sharp Profit Decline Signals Margin Pressure Despite Revenue Surge
item.description: Kamat Hotels (India) Ltd., the Mumbai-based operator of The Orchid near the domestic airport, reported consolidated net profit of ₹17.30 crores for Q3 FY26 (October-December 2025), marking a sharp 33.92% year-on-year decline from ₹26.18 crores in Q3 FY25. The micro-cap hospitality company, with a market capitalisation of ₹645.00 crores, saw its stock plunge 9.04% to ₹200.35 following the results announcement, reflecting investor concerns about deteriorating profitability despite robust top-line growth. Time: 32 minutes ago

item.title: AWFIS Space Solutions Ltd Falls to 52-Week Low Amidst Market Volatility
item.description: AWFIS Space Solutions Ltd has touched a new 52-week low of Rs.374.05 today, marking a significant decline in its stock price amid a period of heightened volatility and sustained downward momentum. The stock’s performance contrasts sharply with broader market gains, reflecting ongoing concerns within the diversified commercial services sector. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Rainbow Childrens Medicare Ltd Falls to 52-Week Low of Rs.1110.5
item.description: Rainbow Childrens Medicare Ltd’s stock declined sharply to a fresh 52-week low of Rs.1110.5 on 3 February 2026, marking a significant setback after a brief two-day rally. The stock underperformed its sector by 4.66% and closed the day down 3.02%, reflecting growing concerns among market participants. Time: 2 hours ago
